alert.note: Alert for Jones; Lenoir; Onslow (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 1:00PM EDT until June 22 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT FOR JONES...LENOIR AND ONSLOW COUNTIES... At 100 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Institute to Phillips Crossroads to Piney Green, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Kinston, La Grange, New River Station, Pumpkin Center, Piney Green, Half Moon, Camp Lejeune Center, Swansboro, Grifton, Phillips Crossroads, Hubert, Richlands, Deep Run, Maysville, Catherine Lake, Silverdale, Kellum, Midway Park and Verona. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please send your reports of hail and/or wind damage, including trees or large limbs downed, by calling the National Weather Service office in Newport at 1-800-889-6889. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
